thread.title: Camper rental for visiting Iceland in September
thread.title_full: Camper rental for visiting Iceland in September

title: Camper rental for visiting Iceland in September
text:
Camper rental for visiting Iceland in September WEBWIRE – Friday, September 11, 2015 Camper rental Iceland 
Renting a camper is definitely the way to go if youre visiting Iceland with a family or friends. Increasingly, more travelers are opting to explore this unique country under their own initiative. 
The good news for tourist is that Iceland remains open for business until late September, when camping in Iceland is still realistic, even in the starkly beautiful interior, following the Golden Circle for a few days and camp out in among the wilderness of this famously volcanic island. 
Visitors to Iceland have been using companies like CampEasy for several years, renting small or large campervans designed for potentially chilly or wet weather, and suitable equipped so you can camp. 
Iceland is one of those countries where you keep wanting to stop and take pictures. Around every corner is a new, wondrous landscape of moody coastlines or volcanic hills and mountains. This is one reason camping and self-drive tours have become popular among visitors. 
Another reason campervans and camping are popular among tourists is their cost saving. Camping is considerably cheaper than the local hotels, and gives you more freedom of choice on where to pitch tent for the night. 
CampEasy provide several options for a camping trip in Iceland. Either you can opt for the SUV type vehicles that have plenty of room and come equipped with all the gear you might need, including a heater and mini-fridge, or a proper camper van in which you have beds provided and neednt bother with tents. 
Read more about camper rental with CampEasy here: www.campervanrental.is 
( Press Release Image: http://photos.webwire.com/prmedia/11240/200001/200001-1.jpg )
